marketNews.title: US Inflation Aligns with Expectations, Fed Rate Cut On Track
marketNews.content:
The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in the United States increased in August 2025 compared to July 2025, although the increase remained in line with consensus expectations. The monthly and annual CPI inflation growth in August 2025 was the fastest since January 2025. The details are as follows:
1. CPI month-over-month (MoM): 0.4% (consensus: 0.3%; July 2025: 0.2%)
2. CPI year-over-year (YoY): 2.9% (consensus: 2.9%; July 2025: 2.7%)
3. Core CPI MoM: 0.3% (consensus: 0.3%; July 2025: 0.3%)
4. Core CPI YoY: 3.1% (consensus: 3.1%; July 2025: 3.1%)

In a separate report, the number of initial jobless claims rose by 27,000 last week to a level of 263,000, higher than the consensus expectation of 235,000.

Earlier, on 9 September 2025, the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics said that the U.S. economy was likely to create 911,000 fewer non-farm payroll jobs than previously estimated over the 12-month period ending March 2025. This indicated that U.S. job growth had slowed before the aggressive import tariff policy of President Donald Trump. Reuters reported that the still-elevated inflation amid a weakening labor market raised concerns about U.S. economic uncertainty ahead, particularly the risk of stagflation.

The weak labor market reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut rates at next week’s meeting. According to the CME FedWatch Tool on Friday (12 September), the probability that the Fed will cut rates next week reached 100%, with a 25-basis-point cut probability of 92.7% and a 50-basis-point cut probability of 7.3%.

In response to the U.S. inflation data, U.S. equity markets closed higher: the Dow Jones rose 1.36% to an all-time high of 46,108 on Thursday (11 September), while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq each gained 0.85% and 0.72% respectively. On the same day, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell 2.48 basis points to about 4.02%.

In Indonesia, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed up 1.37% on Friday (12 September), with the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield falling 5.1 basis points to about 6.33% and the rupiah strengthening 0.51% against the U.S. dollar to 16,378 per dollar.

Key Takeaway: The increasing certainty of a Fed rate cut could open space for Bank Indonesia to implement further rate cuts to support economic growth. Bloomberg consensus projects the BI rate to be at 4.75% by the end of 2025, implying one more 25-basis-point cut. We assess that the government’s success in reviving economic growth could become a positive catalyst to reverse foreign outflows. The government is also preparing a new stimulus package, the details of which (size, target recipients, and duration) need close monitoring by investors.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Friday (12 September) that President Prabowo Subianto has ordered a new stimulus to boost the economy. According to Bloomberg, the stimulus includes: (1) tax incentives for hotels, restaurants, and cafés; (2) an extension of food assistance for three months; (3) expanded coverage of work-accident, unemployment, and death insurance for online-motorcycle-taxi drivers; (4) an internship program for fresh graduates; and (5) housing assistance. The Coordinating Ministry is discussing the details, so the exact amount and period are still unknown.
2. Metro TV reported that the government has seized 148 hectares of PT Weda Bay Nickel’s mining land in Halmahera, North Maluku, due to alleged permit violations. The State-Owned Enterprises Ministry will manage the area and impose fines on PT Weda Bay Nickel. Bloomberg noted that this is the first enforcement action since President Prabowo pledged to crack down on mining law violations. Weda Bay Nickel’s concession covers 47,000 hectares and produced more than 30 million tonnes of nickel ore in 2024. The mine is owned by Tsingshan Holding Group, Eramet SA, and Aneka Tambang (ANTM). An Eramet spokesperson told Reuters that no significant impact on mining operations is expected.
3. The government on Friday (12 September) handed over 674,178 hectares of seized palm-oil plantation land to state-owned PT Agrinas Palma Nusantara, bringing the total land transferred to the company to 1.5 million hectares. Reuters reported that this handover cements Agrinas’s status as the world’s largest palm-oil company by land area. The task force said Agrinas could produce 5.7 million tonnes of crude palm oil per year. An additional 1.8 million hectares are still being verified for possible transfer. Bloomberg reported that Agrinas, which currently operates 17 palm-oil mills, plans to add new mills to process the newly acquired estates and will cooperate with Palm Co. to produce the “Minyakita” cooking oil.
4. The Chairman of Kalbe Farma (KLBF), Ronny Hadiana, bought 900,000 KLBF shares at an average price of 1,150 rupiah per share on 8 September 2025. The transaction value was about 1 billion rupiah. After the purchase, Hadiana’s direct ownership in KLBF remained roughly 0.2%.
5. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) on Friday (12 September) awarded the Perkasa offshore block in East Java to TIS Petroleum (Asia) Pte. Ltd. The block is estimated to contain 228 million barrels of oil or 1.3 trillion cubic feet of gas. The ministry also announced the award of the Gagah block in South Sumatra, estimated to hold 173 million barrels of oil or 1.1 trillion cubic feet of gas.
6. Victoria Insurance (VINS) plans a private placement of approximately 146.1 million shares (10% of its capital). The execution price and investors have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used to strengthen the company’s capital structure to meet the minimum equity requirement of 250 billion rupiah, which must be satisfied by 31 December 2026. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 20 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBTN: Liquidity Injection Details
tickerNews.content: $BBTN: Bank Tabungan Negara announced it will receive 25 trillion rupiah from the total 200 trillion rupiah government cash reserve to be channeled into the Indonesian banking system. Meanwhile, Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) will each receive 55 trillion rupiah, and the remaining 10 trillion rupiah will be allocated to Bank Syariah Indonesia ($BRIS). BBTN added that the funds will be placed in a six-month deposit-on-call instrument that can be rolled over, yielding approximately 4% interest/return. In a separate statement, the Director General of the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, said the liquidity injection is specifically intended to stimulate credit disbursement in priority government programs, not to be re-invested in sovereign bonds (SBN) or SRBI.

tickerNews.title: SIDO: Export Sales Target
tickerNews.content: $SIDO: The Director of the Jamu and Pharmaceutical Industry at Sido Muncul, Budiyanto, said the company aims to increase its export sales contribution to 15-17% of total sales within the next five years, up from 9.7% in the first half of 2025. To achieve this, SIDO plans to enter new markets such as Indochina and African countries and launch new products for export. SIDO is already present in 30 countries, with Malaysia, the Philippines, and Nigeria being the three main destinations.

tickerNews.title: ANTM: Nickel Smelter Project Timeline
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: The Director of Aneka Tambang, Arianto S. Rudjito, said the company targets the construction of a nickel RKEF smelter in Buli, East Halmahera, to start as early as late September or October 2025. The smelter, built together with Ningbo Contemporary Brunp Lygend Co. Ltd., is expected to be completed by the end of 2026, with commissioning scheduled for 2027. Initially, the smelter is planned to produce 88,000 tonnes per year of nickel pig iron. ANTM holds a 40% stake in the project, which is valued at US$1.4 billion.

tickerNews.title: BLOG: Cold-Storage Expansion Plan
tickerNews.content: $BLOG: The Director of Trimitra Trans Persada, Wanny Wijaya, said the company plans to build cold-storage facilities in several regions—Batam, Medan, Manado, Bali, and Palembang—though no specific start-up or operational dates were disclosed. The company also expects cold-storage projects in Tangerang and Boyolali to be completed this year, while those in Makassar and Pontianak are slated for the first half of 2026. For 2025, BLOG earmarks approximately 500 billion rupiah in capex, with 200 billion rupiah allocated to warehouse expansion and the remainder for fleet growth. Currently, BLOG operates more than 3,300 vehicles and 14 cold-storage facilities, with 124 operational points across 47 cities in 23 Indonesian provinces.

tickerNews.title: WIRG: Share Transfer by PT WIR Global Kreatif
tickerNews.content: $WIRG: PT WIR Global Kreatif transferred 467.4 million shares of WIRG at an average price of 170 rupiah per share on 10 September 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 79.5 billion rupiah and was intended for internal strategic purposes. After the transaction, PT WIR Global Kreatif’s direct ownership in WIRG decreased from 9.432% to 5.517%.

tickerNews.title: RUIS: Sale of 5% Stake in PT Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power
tickerNews.content: $RUIS: Radiant Utama Interinsco, through its subsidiary PT Supraco Indonesia (SPC), announced the sale of a 5% stake in PT Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power to OTP Geothermal Pte. Ltd. and KS Orka Renewables Pte. Ltd. for a total consideration of US$10.5 million. The transaction with OTP Geothermal, valued at approximately US$7.5 million, was settled by offsetting the purchase price against SPC’s debt to OTP Geothermal. The sale to KS Orka Renewables, valued at about US$3 million, was paid in cash. RUIS had previously announced the plan in July 2025 but had not disclosed the transaction value at that time.

tickerNews.title: KLBF: Share Purchase by Chairman Ronny Hadiana
tickerNews.content: $KLBF: The Chairman of Kalbe Farma, Ronny Hadiana, purchased 900,000 KLBF shares at an average price of 1,150 rupiah per share on 8 September 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 1 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Hadiana’s direct ownership in KLBF remained roughly 0.2%, showing no significant change.

tickerNews.title: VINS: Planned Private Placement
tickerNews.content: $VINS: Victoria Insurance plans to conduct a private placement of approximately 146.1 million shares, representing 10% of its capital. The execution price and prospective investors have not been disclosed. Proceeds from the corporate action will be used to strengthen the company’s capital structure to meet the minimum equity requirement of 250 billion rupiah, which must be satisfied by 31 December 2026. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 20 October 2025.
